page.title: 04A Wolds Farm
page.content:
{Size of farm:}80 acres{ {Crops} {:}All grass {Livestock :}74 cows. All friesians (black & white) 11 heifers due to calve from November 1985. 13 young heifers under a year old. 1 Hereford bull (red with white head)
I get up at 5.15 a.m. This always seems a lot easier in the summer when the sun is shining, and it is daylight. The first thing I do in summer is to move the electric fence so that when the cows return after milking they have some fresh grass to eat straight away. Milking begins at about 6.00 a.m. and usually takes about two hours.(continued)
